column5: Can anyone out there help me with any suggestions or place where some good winter lake trout can be found in Ontario?

Depends on where you are and how far you want to travel. If NW Ontario is a possibility and I don't think you can do better than the Nestor Falls area. Crow (Kakagi) lake is real good as is Whitefish Bay on LOTW. They are about 75 miles from Int. Falls,MN so you can figue your time. Be sure to check the regulations. Good Luck
Great trout fishing in the Atikokan area. Try Browns Clearwater West.
What lakes would you suggest in the Atikokan area? What is Browns clearwater west?

It is the name of a resort on clearwater west lake. There are numerous hits if you do a search for the lake. Browns' Clearwater West Lodge Activities:Fishing, Nature, Boating, Welcome to Browns' Clearwater West Lodge. We offer accommodations for all occasions and all seasons. Our beautiful setting is perfect for corporate gatherings, family reunions, weddings for both large and small groups alike. Fishing: All of us have a very important role to play in the continued enjoyment of fishing in a world class environment. Many of our guests are already practicing fish conservation techniques. American Plan and Housekeeping Cottages. Fully equipped vacation cottages and separate outpost cottages on the lake offering magnificent views and private settings. Our campground is located on our 1500 ft white sand beach. Fall bear, moose, deer and small game are plentiful. Facilities: Housekeeping Cottages Dining Room- Yes Store - No Maid Service -No Children - Yes Play Area - Yes Pets - No Docking - Yes Beach - Yes Engli

Here is a link to Brown's http://www.brownsclearwaterlodge.com Barry is the owner and a great guy. They get huge lakers just out from the lodge. I think I saw pictures of one over 30 Lbs at a Sport show a couple of years ago. You will have a great trip. Go for it.
